20110121040309.000|20110121040311.000|CC1|BUDGET SUMMARY.

20110121040313.000|20110121040314.000|CC1|INDIVIDUALS FROM MEDICAID

20110121040503.000|20110121040504.000|CC1|WHICH THEY WILL ONLY GET        
20110121040504.000|20110121040505.000|CC1|COMPENSATED TO THE TUNE OF      
20110121040505.000|20110121040506.000|CC1|PENNIES ON THE DOLLAR.

20110121040508.000|20110121040509.000|CC1|JUST AREN'T GOING TO DO THESE   
20110121040509.000|20110121040510.000|CC1|TRANSPLANTS.

20110121040511.000|20110121040512.000|CC1|TO THE PATIENTS YOU'VE GOT TO   
20110121040512.000|20110121040514.000|CC1|PAY FOR IT AND IF YOU CAN'T PAY 
20110121040514.000|20110121040515.000|CC1|FOR IT WE'RE NOT GOING TO

20110121040546.000|20110121040547.000|CC1|SENATE BILL 1001, AND           
20110121040547.000|20110121040548.000|CC1|REPRESENTATIVE TOVAR HAS

20110121040549.000|20110121040550.000|CC1|THE HOUSE TO TRY AND RESTORE THE

20110121040554.000|20110121040556.000|CC1|THE CHAIR OF THE COMMITTEE THIS

20110121040559.000|20110121040600.000|CC1|THERE ARE STILL 96 PEOPLE       
20110121040600.000|20110121040601.000|CC1|COUNTING ON US TO RESTORE THIS  
20110121040601.000|20110121040602.000|CC1|FUNDING.

20110121040604.000|20110121040606.000|CC1|WAS THAT THE GOVERNOR HAS TOLD  
20110121040606.000|20110121040607.000|CC1|HIM, REPRESENTATIVE -- SENATOR  
20110121040607.000|20110121040608.000|CC1|BIGGS, THE CHAIR OF THAT

20110121040611.000|20110121040612.000|CC1|SO THE GOVERNOR DOES NOT WANT   
20110121040612.000|20110121040614.000|CC1|THIS TRANSPLANT FUNDING         
20110121040614.000|20110121040615.000|CC1|RESTORED, AND NO MATTER WHAT    
20110121040615.000|20110121040617.000|CC1|KIND OF SOLUTIONS WE CAN COME UP
20110121040617.000|20110121040618.000|CC1|WITH SHE IS BASICALLY SO AGAINST
20110121040618.000|20110121040619.000|CC1|IT THAT SHE'S ACTUALLY TELLING  
20110121040619.000|20110121040621.000|CC1|THE LEGISLATURE NOT TO HEAR THE

20110121043739.000|20110121043742.000|CC1|DEBATE ON LEGISLATION.

20110121043751.000|20110121043753.000|CC1|ENACTED OVER THE NEXT CENTURY,  
20110121043753.000|20110121043754.000|CC1|MOSTLY BECAUSE THE MAJORITY     
20110121043754.000|20110121043755.000|CC1|COULD JUST CHANGE THE SENATE

20110121043759.000|20110121043802.000|CC1|WHICH IS EXACTLY WHAT HAPPENED  
20110121043802.000|20110121043804.000|CC1|IN 1917, WHEN 12 ANTI-WAR

20110121043809.000|20110121043811.000|CC1|THE RULES.                      
20110121043811.000|20110121043813.000|CC1|THEY ADOPTED CLOTURE OF DEBATE, 
20110121043813.000|20110121043814.000|CC1|IN WHICH A 2/3 VOTE WOULD END A 
20110121043814.000|20110121043817.000|CC1|FILIBUSTER.                     
20110121043817.000|20110121043819.000|CC1|THAT LASTED THROUGH 1975, WHEN A
20110121043819.000|20110121043820.000|CC1|PROCEDURAL BATTLE LED TO A

20110121043823.000|20110121043825.000|CC1|ONLY 60 VOTES.

20110121043826.000|20110121043829.000|CC1|NEW SYSTEM THAT ALLOWED TWO OR  
20110121043829.000|20110121043830.000|CC1|MORE PIECES OF LEGISLATION TO BE
